title: After the upgrade to 115.2.2 I lost all of the contents of my Sent folder - Help
content:
I am a long time Thunderbird email user (back to Eudora) and never have had a problem until recently with 115.2.2 . I lost all of the contents of my Sent folder. I see the new Thunderbird sent email folder icon but it is empty.

Please help me find my lost sent emails and tell me how to prevent this from happening again. Thanks you in advance for your thoughts on this issue. chuck hall
creator: cohall46

title: Automatic update to 115.2.2 (64-bit) deleted folders
content:
This morning I opened Thunderbird to find a very different program. All my junk mail and spam folders are gone. My main account Sent folder, Drafts folder, and Trash folder are gone. All my accounts are IMAP.

In Webmail for my main account are two drafts, 1911 junk, 1193 trash, 5280 sent

WTF?
creator: jonf2

title: remove message pane altogether
content: Just updated Thunderbird and - surprise! - it's an entirely new beast. I like the way my messages list seems to hold more, every line is closer together and the font may even be smaller. Strangely, despite everything being more compact, my Folders list used to have more space at the bottom. My big complaint though is when trying to access the bottom message in the messages list, sometimes I go a bit low and there is suddenly a blue bar. I dragged it and it is the Message Pane. I do not want that. At all. I thought by disabling it, it was gone, but there it is, encroaching on my most recent message! I tried expanding the density, but it exploded everything. I just need a bit of space between the last message and the edge of the list. Or get rid of the Message Pane. Is there any way to get some padding at the bottom of the message list, or get rid of the Message Pane entirely? Thanks!
creator: saladgoat

title: Version 115.2.2 - I do not like the new font, overall appearance, is it possible to change it?
content:
I would really like to have the old look back

Please advise me if it is possible and how to do it

Thank you

title: missing accounts in unified folders Tbird 115.2.2
content:
Like many others, I'm seriously considering going back to v112 because I find SO many of the changes in 115 "change for the sake of change," "fixing" things that weren't broken, and breaking functionality that we thought was stable. Not keeping thins like the default font that was selected in the previous version before the upgrade is just plain annoying.

I use Thunderbird to manage many email accounts across different profiles. Not all accounts show up in unified folders, although all accounts are visible in the "All folders" view. Is there any way to "reset" anything to fix this? The Unified folders "Inbox" view in 112 was the best way to see all accounts that had new messages.
creator: moz1

title: How many times do I have to press J on spammers for Thunderbird to start automatically moving emails from those spammer into the junk folder?
content:
I have the options set on my email account settings and in the Thunderbird general settings. Both places, I have told Thunder bird to move new junk messages to "Junk" folder on "me@myemailaddress.com."

I also have the option "Enable adaptive junk filter logging" checked, if that makes any difference.

How long is this supposed to take to train Thunderbird to automatically start putting junk in the Junk folder instead of my inbox? Because I have marked several of these spammers by pressing the J key and forcing them into the Junk folder this way, but they still keep coming into my inbox. The same exact email addresses I already marked as "junk" by pressing J at least 3 times are still hitting my inbox.
creator: CCSnider

title: Import mails from Outlook

title: Supernova (115.2.2) the CPU - related to calendar
content:
Until I updated to Supernova (115.2.2) the CPU usage was low but since the update there is a high usage on a Lenovo Win 10 PC that is up to date.

It seems it is related to the calendar. If the calendar is not brought into focus immediately after starting SuperNova the CPU usage is up around 14%. Once the calendar is brought into focus and I go back to any inbox the CPU usage drops to less than 1%
creator: selfsimilar01

title: Thunderbird did an update and now doesn't work
content:
HI, On September 16, Thunderbird did an update. Now it opens very very slowly and doesn't show the inbox. NOW the screen is FILLED with a BIG message that says THUNDERBIRD -- Support US.

Before the update, it opened quickly to the INBOX.

The INBOX doesn't open. It shows only a few emails and they are all gray and white. There aren't any GRID LINES separating the emails.

Messages refuse to send . Sometimes they send and sometimes there's an error message. I have to copy the email into WEBMAIL and send it from WEBMAIL.

HOW can I get the OLD THUNDERBIRD BACK????

I was depending on Thunderbird to run my business.

Since Thunderbird doesn't work anymore, I'll have to find another EMAIL PROGRAM.

Sincerely, Skippy Mardon

title: Supernova update broke my TB, Microsoft OAUTH2 window is in a Pop-up loop.
content:
Hi,

I have been working with TB for years now without an issue. Today it updated to 115.2.2, and I can't view or send emails from my account. A couple of years ago I setup my Outlook account in TB with the 2FA Outlook security feature and in the day it was a headache also, but now with the update... For what I can understand, TB has done something in this last update that has broken that link and now the Pop-up window to login is bugged, I can't write my email, but the part asking about my password is never shown, when I click next after writing my email, the window just disappears, and if I clic on send an email or go to any folder, I get the Pop-up window again, also the notification on the right about "Failure of identification when trying to connect to outlook.office.365.com" Like I said, this was configured and worked fine. I can login to my Outlook account, I have disabled my antivirus, don't have any other app open, I tried the "Help -> troubleshoot mode", erased cache, restarted my pc, I even tried to change the "Identification Method" to "no identification" or "normal password" instead of "OAuth2", the only thing that doing this last change does is that if the OAuth2 is selected the Pop-up window is completly black, while when the setting is on "normal password" for example, the screen at least shows up correctly, but still can't go past the email part. Nothing has worked so far.

Thanks in advance.
creator: ronald_16_1989

title: Thunderbird Supernova 115.2.2 grossi problemi
content: Buongiorno, con gli aggiornamenti automatici sono passato da Thunderbird 102.15.1 a Supernova 115.2.2. Ho una serie di problemi: - Vedo l'albero delle cartelle - vari account - esattamente come era strutturato prima ma non mi è dato di vedere le email al loro interno. Vedo il contatore a finca della posta in arrivo ma non posso vedere cosa c'è all'interno. - Nonostante imposti con flag la visulaizzazione del mostrate tutte le cartelle, tale impostazioni ad ogni riavvio non viene tenuta. - Ho testato un invio di email e l'ho controllata dal telefono, risulta correttamente inviata e arrivata. Spero sia solo un problema di visualizzazione, non vorrei averperso tutto l'archivio. Vorrei ritornare alma versione 102.15.1 ma devo rifare tutti gli account pare, per incompatibilità con Supernova... Come si deve procedere? Grazie
creator: Ommy
